definition: to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to cover up (a shortcoming)/to screen off/to hide/to conceal
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
to go into a huff
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
ability/skill
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
indecisive/wavering
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
happy-go-lucky people/optimists
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
wordless and silent (idiom); without speaking/taciturn
